article:
{{Speciesbox
| name = Garlic taxon = Allium sativum image = Allium sativum Woodwill 1793.jpg
| image_caption = Allium sativum, known as garlic, from William Woodville,
| Medical Botany, 1793. authority = L.
}} 'Allium sativum', commonly known as 'garlic', is a species in the onion
genus, [[Allium]]. Its close relatives include the onion, shallot, leek,
chive, and rakkyo. With a history of
human use of over 7,000 years, garlic is native to central Asia, Ensminger,
AH (1994). Foods & nutrition encyclopedia, Volume 1. CRC Press, 1994. ISBN 0-8493-8980-
1. p. 750 and has long been a staple in the Mediterranean region, as well
as a frequent seasoning in Asia, Africa, and Europe. It was known to Ancient
Egyptians, and has been used for both culinary and medicinal purposes.
